title: Cheverus school logotype
content:
The C is probably custom as their logo has always been a cross inside a C in various fonts, but the rest looks pretty consistent. Appreciate any help.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Cheverus.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119132256/http:/typophile.com/files/Cheverus_0.gif) | 10.66 KB |

 [‹ 45 ° Angle Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119132256/http:/typophile.com/node/16522 "Go to previous forum topic") [Script font, but poor quality example, any ideas? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119132256/http:/typophile.com/node/16521 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Tommy

comments.content:
Exocet (modified) by Jonathan Barnbrook from Emigre.  
 [http://emigre.com/EF.php?fid=95](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119132256/http:/emigre.com/EF.php?fid=95 "http://emigre.com/EF.php?fid=95")
I actually prefer [Sophia](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119132256/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/sophia/sophia/) which is similar, but in my opinion, more legible.
ewww. that isn’t modified, it is squooshed!
Yes, Sophia is nice and No, squooshed is much too kind.

Hey, I never knew Jesuits see themselves are satanists!

hhp
